title: Boehner yuks it up at RTCA dinner
content:
House Speaker John Boehner donned a tux and delivered a few zingers at the Radio & TV Congressional Correspondents ' Dinner on Friday night .
“ I hope all of you are fine . I ’ m fine . Just like the private sector , ” Boehner quipped at the beginning of his remarks at the 68th annual press gathering held at the Washington Convention Center .
Boehner teased a few journalists in the room – calling NBC ’ s Luke Russert a “ loud mouth ” and telling MSNBC ’ s Ed Schultz that he never watches his show – and , on a more serious note , thanked the media for its coverage of Congress .
Noting how press access on Capitol Hill has expanded over time , he joked , “ A word to the wise : Before you go out there , understand that the microphones and cameras are already on . ”
“ I learned this the hard way last September , ” he said , recalling a hot mic moment between him and Vice President Joe Biden . “ Thank God we were taking about golf . You know it could have been anything ! ”
Comedian Wayne Brady took the stage after Boehner . Brady – who signed on to headline the dinner after Louis C.K . dropped out amid controversy – treated the crowd to some improv and a few funny songs .
Before launching into his own version of “ Let ’ s Stay Together ” by Al Green , Brady joked , “ If our president can do it , I can do it , too . ”
He ended his set crooning “ Love Me Even Though I ’ m Republican , '' channeling Prince .
“ Please just love me even though I ’ m Republican / I ’ m just looking out for you , hands off government / Liberal , no I ’ m not loving it / Because all I want to do is make love to you . Can I just ? I ’ m Republican / Babe , I love you and even though I ’ m not generally for love itself , or puppies , or anything , or bright lights / I ’ d make an exception , I ’ d do anything to be with you baby / I ’ d pass any bill that needs to be passed/ Baby , I would even let people of the same sex – well , I wouldn ’ t go that far . ''
content_original:
Boehner yuks it up at RTCA dinner

(AP Photo)

House Speaker John Boehner donned a tux and delivered a few zingers at the Radio & TV Congressional Correspondents' Dinner on Friday night.

“I hope all of you are fine. I’m fine. Just like the private sector,” Boehner quipped at the beginning of his remarks at the 68th annual press gathering held at the Washington Convention Center.

Boehner teased a few journalists in the room – calling NBC’s Luke Russert a “loud mouth” and telling MSNBC’s Ed Schultz that he never watches his show – and, on a more serious note, thanked the media for its coverage of Congress.

Noting how press access on Capitol Hill has expanded over time, he joked, “A word to the wise: Before you go out there, understand that the microphones and cameras are already on.”

“I learned this the hard way last September,” he said, recalling a hot mic moment between him and Vice President Joe Biden. “Thank God we were taking about golf. You know it could have been anything!”

Comedian Wayne Brady took the stage after Boehner. Brady – who signed on to headline the dinner after Louis C.K. dropped out amid controversy – treated the crowd to some improv and a few funny songs.

Before launching into his own version of “Let’s Stay Together” by Al Green, Brady joked, “If our president can do it, I can do it, too.”

He ended his set crooning “Love Me Even Though I’m Republican," channeling Prince.

A few of the lyrics:

“Please just love me even though I’m Republican / I’m just looking out for you, hands off government / Liberal, no I’m not loving it / Because all I want to do is make love to you. Can I just? I’m Republican / Babe, I love you and even though I’m not generally for love itself, or puppies, or anything, or bright lights / I’d make an exception, I’d do anything to be with you baby / I’d pass any bill that needs to be passed/ Baby, I would even let people of the same sex – well, I wouldn’t go that far."
